article_title: How Employer-Based Health Insurance Actually Is Cheaper Than Government-Sponsored Insurance

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: Princeton health economist Uwe Reinhardt this week posted a very entertaining (no surprise there) and informative response to Sally Pipes' claim that Employer Health Insurance: A Bargain Compared to Government-Sponsored Coverage (read: Medicare and Medicaid). It's hard to disagree with most of what Prof. Reinhardt has offered in his rebuttal. But at the risk of having my own post become a "platform for a homework assignment in undergraduate health-economics courses," let me suggest that Sally Pipes may actually be right for reasons she never even addressed.
